        public long getSecondsRun()
        Returns:
        how many seconds have passed since this Game has been instantiated

      • getScheduler

        public TaskScheduler getScheduler()
        Returns:
        gets the TaskScheduler of this Game. The TaskScheduler can be used to schedule Tasks which will be run at a specified interval or once a certain time. For more information see TaskScheduler#scheduleTask

        @Nullable
public static Game get()
        Returns:
        the current Game singleton

      • initialise

        @Deprecated
protected void initialise()
        Deprecated. 
        will get called when the Game is initialised right before the gameLoop gets started (before the first game tick) override this on your Game to do initialisation might get removed because you can use your Game´s constructor for initialisation

      • displayStats

        protected void displayStats(java.lang.String[] toDisplay)
        Parameters:
        toDisplay - a String array with information to be displayed on the top left of the screen override this and call super#displayStats to change the displayed stats even if you don´t have stats to display you should definitely override this

      • getCurrentFPS

        Returns:

      • getDeltaTime

        public double getDeltaTime()
        Returns:
        the time in seconds that passed since the last frame

      • getDeltaTime

        public double getDeltaTime(boolean ignorePaused)
        Parameters:
        ignorePaused - if paused should be ignored for the return value - this can be useful if you want to only pause GameObjects but not UI animations
        Returns:
        the current deltaTime or #getDeltaTime
